#Text=The Miami Heat ( 15 - 9 ) defeated the Brooklyn Nets ( 7 - 18 ) 104 - 98 on Wednesday night .
#Text=This game was tight throughout and the Nets had yet another close loss .
#Text=It was a second quarter in which Brooklyn allowed 33 points and scored just 20 of their own that very well may have decided this game .
#Text=Miami shot 53 percent from the field and outrebounded the Nets 44 - 35 in the win .
#Text=There were only 18 combined turnovers , so it was a well - played , clean game all - around .
#Text=Dwyane Wade shot just 3 - for - 16 in his most previous game , but was spectacular here .
#Text=He went 13 - for - 17 from the field to accumulate 28 points , five rebounds , two assists and three blocks in the win .
#Text=When Wade is playing like this , the Heat are a hard team to beat .
#Text=Hassan Whiteside had been struggling lately but had a nice game here , tallying 20 points and 13 rebounds .
#Text=Goran Dragic also continued his recent good form , as he totaled 16 points , five assists , three rebounds and two steals in the victory .
#Text=This four - headed monster of Wade , Whiteside , Dragic and Chris Bosh is a scary combo and they should be able to compete with anyone if all four are on their game .
#Text=Miami will look to keep up the momentum when they host the Toronto Raptors on Friday in their next game .
#Text=The Nets haven’t been as bad as their 7 - 18 record would indicate and they just ca n't seem to close games out late .
#Text=They played poor defense here as well , as they allowed 53 percent shooting and drew just 12 turnovers in the loss .
#Text=Brook Lopez led the team with 25 points , but Jarrett Jack was the best player on Wednesday .
#Text=Jack tallied 22 points and 10 assists and continues to show that he 's a legitimate starting point guard in this league .
#Text=Brooklyn will have another tough task , when they travel to Indiana to take on the Pacers in their next game on Friday .
